messageBody:
On 8/28/06, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> On 8/28/06, Andrew McDonagh <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
> >
> > I rely upon Acceptance tests to test this kind of 3rd party integration
> > issues. I find it make my unit tests smaller, easier to write, faster to
> > run, adding a layer of indirection between the application code and its
> > dependencies, etc.
>
>
> It will probably make your unit tests smaller, but when the bug happens, it
> will take you longer to isolate it because only your acceptance tests will
> fail, and probably in mysterious ways (such as leaking connections).
>
> I prefer for my tests to catch bugs as soon as possible (especially in this
> case, where invoking close() will not make them that much slower).

Trust me, it doesn't take very long to find and debug a connection
error in production jdbc drivers. Been there, done that and have
several t-shirts. I think you're chasing a non-issue, Cédric.

Simon
